lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Blue.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What do you need help with?

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

BlueBot is a desktop chatbot that helps you manage tasks quickly from plain-text commands.
Shows a list of all tasks stored.
Adds a new todo task to the list.
Adds a new deadline task to the list.
Adds a new event task to the list.
Format: `event DESCRIPTION /from DATE [YYYY MM DD] /to DATE [YYYY MM DD]`
Marks the specified task(s) in the list as done.
* Marks the task at the specified `INDEX`.
* The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed person list.
* The index **must be a positive integer** 1, 2, 3... or all
* Multiple indexes can be used at once if separated by a comma.
* `mark all` marks all tasks as done
* `mark 1` marks the 1st task in the list as done.
* `mark 1, 2, 4` marks the 1st, 2nd, 4th task in the list as done.
* `mark all` marks all tasks in the list as done.
Unmarks the specified task(s) in the list as done.
* Same formatting and usage as the mark command.
* `unmark 1` unmarks the 1st task in the list as done.
* `unmark 1, 2, 4` unmarks the 1st, 2nd, 4th task in the list as done.
* `unmark all` unmarks all tasks in the listas done.
Deletes the specified task(s) from the list.
* Same formatting and usage as the mark command.
* `delete 1` deletes the 1st task in the list.
* `delete 1, 2, 4` deletes the 1st, 2nd, 4th task in the list.
* `delete all` deletes all tasks in the list.
Finds tasks whose description contain any of the given keywords
* The search is case-insensitive. e.g `homework` will match `Homework`
* The order of the keywords does not matter. e.g. `homework complete` will match `complete homework`
* Partial words will be matched e.g. `work` will match `homework`
* Tasks matching at least one keyword will be returned (i.e. OR search).
e.g. `books homework` will return `return books`, `complete homework`
* `find project books` returns `project meeting` and `return books`
* Blue is a task management chatbot application that helps users organize and track their tasks.
* The application supports common task operations such as adding, listing, marking as done/undone,
* deleting tasks, and finding tasks by keyword. It persists task data to a file and provides
* a command-line interface for user interaction.
* Initializes a new instance of the Blue chatbot.
* This constructor sets up the user interface, storage handler, and task list.
* It attempts to load existing tasks from the specified file. If loading fails,
* it initializes an empty task list and displays an error message to the user.
* @param fileName The name of the file used to load and save stored tasks.
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Blue using FXML.
* Represents a command that adds a Deadline task to the task list.
private static final String EMPTY_DESCRIPTION_MESSAGE = "The description can't be empty! =/";
private static final String INVALID_DEADLINE_FORMAT_MESSAGE = "Deadlines must have a deadline... (ꐦ¬_¬)";
"Uh oh! I don't understand that date format, try yyyy-mm-dd!";
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand with raw input arguments.
* @param inputArgs Input string in format "description /by dueDate".
* @throws BlueException if input is completely empty.
* Parses deadline input and adds Deadline task.
* Expected format: "description /by yyyy M d". Splits on "/by", validates
* both description and due date are non-empty, creates Deadline,
* adds to list, shows success message, and saves to storage.
* @param taskList Current list of tasks to modify.
* @param ui       User interface for displaying success message.
* @param storage  Storage handler for persisting changes.
* @throws BlueException if missing description, missing "/by" clause, empty due date,
public String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BlueException {
throw new BlueException("Uh oh! I don't understand that date format, try yyyy-mm-dd!");

* Constructs an AddEventCommand with raw input arguments.
* @param inputArgs Input string in format "description /from startDate /to endDate".
* @throws BlueException if input is completely empty.
* Parses event input and adds Event task.
* Expected format: "description /from yyyy M d /to yyyy M d". Splits sequentially
* on "/from" then "/to", validates all three components (description, start, end)
* are non-empty, creates Event (which validates chronological order),
* adds to list, shows success message, and saves to storage.
* @param taskList Current list of tasks to modify.
* @param ui       User interface for displaying success message.
* @param storage  Storage handler for persisting changes.
* @throws BlueException if missing description, "/from" clause, "/to" clause,
*                       empty dates, invalid date format, or end date before start date.
public String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BlueException {

* @param taskList Current list of tasks to modify.
* @param ui       User interface for displaying success message.
* @param storage  Storage handler for persisting changes.

public String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BlueException {
* Base class for all command implementations in the Blue task management system.
* Defines the contract for command execution and exit status checking.
* All concrete commands extend this abstract class and implement the
* execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage) method to perform their specific operations.
* @param taskList Current list of tasks to operate on.
* @param ui       User interface for displaying results/messages.
* @param storage  File storage for saving task changes.
* @throws BlueException if command execution fails due to invalid input, bounds errors, etc.
public abstract String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BlueException;
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param inputArgs Single integer representing 1-based task index.
* @throws BlueException if argument is not a positive integer.
throw new BlueException("Give me a number ( ｡ •̀ ᴖ •́ ｡)");

* Custom exception class for Blue task management chatbot errors.
* This exception wraps all application-specific errors including invalid user input,
* corrupted storage data, file I/O failures, and unrecognized commands. It provides
* a consistent error handling mechanism throughout the application with user-friendly
* Constructs a new BlueException with the specified error message.
* @param message The detail message describing the error.

* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Parses user input strings into corresponding Command objects.

* type and arguments, then instantiates the appropriate command handler.
* Parses raw user input into the appropriate Command object.
* @param input Raw user input string from console.

* Manages persistent storage of tasks to and from file system.
* This class handles reading tasks from a specified file during startup and
* saving the current task list back to file after modifications.
* The storage directory is created automatically if it doesn't exist.
* Initializes storage with the specified filename.
* @param fileName The name of the file to store tasks (e.g., "Blue.txt").
assert fileName != null && !fileName.isBlank() : "Storage file name should be provided.";
* Loads all tasks from the storage file.
* Returns an empty list if the file doesn't exist. Throws {@link BlueException}
* if file reading fails or data is corrupted/invalid.
* @return List of Task objects loaded from file.
* @throws BlueException if IO error occurs or data format is invalid.
throw new BlueException("Failed to load tasks: " + e.getMessage());

* Creates the parent directory if it doesn't exist. Throws BlueException
* @param taskList The TaskList containing tasks to save.
* @throws BlueException if IO error occurs during file writing.
public void save(TaskList taskList) throws BlueException {

* Represents a Deadline task with a specific due date.
* A Deadline task extends Task by adding a due date parsed from storage format.
* It displays the due date in user-friendly format while storing it in compact format.
* Uses Java's LocalDate for date handling with predefined formatters.
/** Formatter for compact storage: yyyy M d (e.g., "2026 1 1") */
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_STORAGE = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy M d");
/** Formatter for display: dd MMM yyyy (e.g., "1 Jan 2026") */
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_DISPLAY = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy");
* Constructs a new Deadline task with description and due date.
* @param due         Due date string in storage format (yyyy M d).
* Returns the storage format for a Deadline task.
* @return Pipe-delimited string with type "D" and due date for persistence.
* Returns the display representation of a Deadline task.
* @return User-friendly string showing type, status, description, and formatted due date.
* Represents an Event task with start and end dates.
* An Event task extends Task by adding start and end dates.
* Validates that end date is not before start date during construction. Uses the same
* dual-format date handling as Deadline for storage and display.
/** Formatter for compact storage: yyyy M d (e.g., "2026 1 1") */
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_STORAGE = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy M d");
/** Formatter for display: dd MMM yyyy (e.g., "1 Jan 2026") */
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMAT_DISPLAY = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy");
* Constructs a new Event task with description and date range.
* @param from        Start date string in storage format (yyyy M d).
* @param to          End date string in storage format (yyyy M d).
* @throws BlueException if end date is before start date.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) throws BlueException {
throw new BlueException("Events must end after they start!!!");
* Returns the storage format for an Event task.
* @return Pipe-delimited string with type "E" and date range for persistence.
* Returns the display representation of an Event task.
* @return User-friendly string showing type, status, description, and formatted date range.
* Base class for all task types in the Blue task management system.
* Represents a generic task with a description and done/undone status.
* Provides common functionality for marking tasks complete/incomplete and
* generating display/storage representations used by subclasses.
* Constructs a new task with the given description.
* Marks the task as done by setting isDone to true
* Unmarks the task as done by setting isDone to false
* Returns the storage format string for persistence.
* @return String in pipe-delimited format for file storage.
* Returns the user-friendly display representation of the task.
* @return Formatted string showing completion status and description.
* Manages a collection of Task objects for the Blue task management system.
* Provides standard list operations (add, remove, get, size) with 0-based indexing.
* Used as the central data model passed between commands, storage, and UI components.
* Supports both empty initialization and loading from persisted data.
* Creates a task list initialized with existing tasks.
* @param tasks Preloaded Task objects from storage.
assert tasks != null : "TaskList should not store null tasks!";
* Adds a task to the end of the list.
assert task != null : "TaskList should not store null tasks!";
* Removes tasks at the specified 0-based indices.
* @param indices Array of 0-based index of task to remove.
assert indices != null && indices.length > 0 : "Must pass at least one index!";
assert idx >= 0 && idx < tasks.size() : "Index must refer to an existing task before removal!";
* Mark tasks at the specified 0-based indices as done.
* @param indices Array of 0-based index of task to mark as done.
assert indices != null && indices.length > 0 : "Must pass at least one index!";
assert idx >= 0 && idx < tasks.size() : "Index must refer to an existing task before removal!";
* Unmark tasks at the specified 0-based indices as done.
* @param indices Array of 0-based index of task to unmark as done.
assert indices != null && indices.length > 0 : "Must pass at least one index!";
assert idx >= 0 && idx < tasks.size() : "Index must refer to an existing task before removal!";
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return Current size of the task list.
* Retrieves a task at the specified 0-based index.
* @param indices Array of 0-based index of task to retrieve.
assert indices != null && indices.length > 0 : "Must pass at least one index!";
assert idx >= 0 && idx < tasks.size() : "Index must refer to an existing task before retrieving!";
assert task != null : "TaskList should not store null tasks!";
* Returns the complete list of tasks.
* @return An ArrayList containing all the tasks.
* Finds all tasks whose descriptions contain every keyword in the query.
* @param query Search query containing one or more keywords.
* @return List of tasks containing all keywords (case-insensitive match).
assert query != null : "Find query should not be null!";
* Checks whether the given description contains at least one of the
* The comparison is case-insensitive and matches keywords as substrings
* @param description The task description to search within.
* @param keywords A list of keywords to match against.
* @return {@code true} if the description contains any keyword;
private boolean containsAnyKeyword(String description, List<String> keywords) {
* Represents a simple ToDo task without any time constraints.
* A ToDo is the most basic task type that only requires a description.
* It extends Task and adds type-specific formatting for storage

* Handles all user interface interactions for the Blue task management chatbot.
* This class provides methods to display greeting and farewell messages, print task lists,
* show task operation feedback, handle errors, and read user input from the console.
* All output is formatted with decorative divider lines for visual consistency.
* Displays the startup greeting with Blue's ASCII art logo
* followed by asking what the user needs help with.
* Displays the farewell message when exiting the application.
* Wraps the given text with decorative divider lines above and below.
* @param str The message to display with line wrapping.
* Prints a numbered list of tasks or an empty list message.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to display.
public String printList(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws BlueException {
throw new BlueException("Wow! There's nothing to do!");

* Shows confirmation that all tasks are unmarked.
String message = "Okay, I unmarked everything as done!";
